page.lettertext:
fol.461
13 May 1589. At White Hall in the afternone.
A l
re
unto M
r
Bodley as followeth. After o
r
harty comendac
o
ns, whereas the
L Willoughbie
leiutenaunte generall of
her Ma
t
forces in those
tes dothe find
him selfe greatlie touched in honor and reputac
o
n w
th
the charge and accusation
published by the
statt
generall
against him of late theire in printed placardes
wherin allso her Ma
tie
receaveth no small prejudice that they doe thereby
tal
taxe
openlie and defame her lieutenant generall w
th
crymes & imputac
o
ns whereby they
neither made her ma
tie
heretofore acquainted nor yet
ticularlie laide the same to
his Charge, wherefore for his better justification against those slaunders and defence of his
honor he hath besought her Ma
tie
that the states might in her name be pressed to sett
downe their
ticuler proofes whereuppon they ground
theise
ticuler
fees
theese their
generall accusac
o
ns. her Ma
t
pleasure ys therefore yo
u
shall uppon the receipt of
these o
r
l
re
s in her name deale w
th
the Stat
generall and requier them to sett
down in wrightinge and deli
v
unto yo
u
soche proofes and testamonies, as they shalb able
to
duce for the maintaininge and verefyinge of their foresaid accusac
o
ns, Charge and
imputac
o
ns w
ch
they have sett forthe to the viwe of the world and the printed
placcardes againste her saide leiuetenant. And
if
their Comissioners appointed to com
hether be not aleready in the waie, yo
u
shall requier them likewise to instruct
their said Comyssio
n
es w
th
the said
fes and matter to verifie their publique accusac
o
ns
and yett yo
u
shall requier to have the same allso deli
v
ed to yo
r
selfe. wherin yf they
shall goe aboute to delaye yo
u
or refuse to deli
v
unto yo
u
those their proofes and ground
of their accusations, then her Ma
t
pleasure is yo
u
shall requier in publique
manner, by waie of wrighting an Acte to be made thereof that thereby it may
appere to the worlde how they refuse to verife
ticularlie, their said imputac
o
ns
w
ch
they have published in generall termes to the dishonor of the said L. Willoughbye
And so praying yo
u
to take that order as ap
taineth and to certyfie u s accordinglie
we byd yo
u
hartely farewell. &c.
